title: What are examples of high technology crimes? - Quora

response.answer_text: Intellectual property theft: Exploiting weaknesses in a corporate network to gain access to trade secrets that can either be used to realise an unfair advantage in market trading or to releasing your own version of the product first. Man-in-the-middle attacks: Tapping into a section of network cable so that you can listen to the communications between two parties. After sufficient time has past and you get to know enough about their communication systems, you can begin to pretend to be one or both of these trusted parties. This way you can either request information or action that the person on the other end would not normally offer to a third party. Denial-of-service attacks: Basically you identify a common type of request that a server or network element would process and then generate these requests in sufficient volume to exceed whatever number that the device can process.  This allows you to render a critical piece of network unavailable. Exploits such as buffer overflow manouvers: Crafting a special request for a network device that takes advantage of a security vulnerability that allows you to either request information or execute code on a server without being authorised to do so.  The recent heartbleed exploit is one such example that could have been used to obtain the usernames and passwords of other users. The list goes on...
